com.epoch
Class CharReencoder

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.CharReencoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
CharConstants
public class CharReencoder
extends Object
implements CharConstants

Used to interconvert UTF-8 and Latin-1 characters, character entity references, and UCS-2 characters.

cersToUnicode

public String cersToUnicode()
Convert character entity references in a string into a proper Unicode string understood by Java (which is in UCS-2).

Returns:
same contents encoded in UCS-2 (Java internal representation)

Converts non-ASCII UCS-2 characters in a string into the corresponding character entity references.

Returns:
string with only ASCII characters and CERs

inputToCERs

public String inputToCERs()
Determines if any byte sequences in the string inputted by a user are consistent with UTF-8 or extended Latin-1 encoding, and converts them to character entity references.

A UTF-8 byte sequence must be one of the following:

  • 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx

We determine whether each current byte and subsequent bytes are consistent with a UTF-8 encoding. If so, we convert them into CERs. If not, then the bytes are either ASCII or extended Latin-1; if the latter, we convert them into CERs. If we find one Latin-1 character, all characters must be ASCII or Latin-1.

Returns:
the converted String

isASCII

private boolean isASCII(byte bt)
Determines whether a byte represents an ASCII character.

Parameters:
bt - a byte
Returns:
true if the byte represents an ASCII character.

fitsByte1Of2

private boolean fitsByte1Of2(byte bt)
Determines whether a byte may be the 1st byte in a 2-byte UTF-8 sequence representing a character. Such a byte has the sequence 110xxxxx.

Parameters:
bt - a byte
Returns:
true if the byte may be the 1st byte in a 2-byte UTF-8 sequence representing a character

resetBuilder

private int resetBuilder(int numBytes)
Clears the StringBuilder, resets byte number back to the beginning of the String. Used when a Latin-1 character is found after an apparent UTF-8 character.

Parameters:
numBytes - number of bytes in the original String
Returns:
-1

appendUTF8

private void appendUTF8(byte... bts)
Appends a character entity representation of a UTF-8 character to a growing StringBuilder.

Parameters:
bts - array of 2-4 bytes representing the UTF-8 character, starting with the leftmost (first) byte, with the highest bits of the code point

getCodePt

private int getCodePt(byte[] bts)
Gets a Unicode code point from 2-4 bytes representing a character in the UTF-8 format. The bytes will have one of the following sequences:
  • 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx

Parameters:
bts - array of 2-4 bytes representing the UTF-8 character, starting with the leftmost (first) byte, with the highest bits of the code point
Returns:
the Unicode code point
